item.title: Session 1: The Why and What of NLP
item.description:
The Why and What of NLP

This session is an introduction session to NLP. We first motivate the uses and potential uses of NLP. We then introduce some key linguistic concepts for NLP. Finally, we describe NLP in three standart pipelines.

item.title: Session 2: Representing text into vectors
item.description:
Representing text into vectors

This course covers representation learning techniques for Natural Language Processing with a specific focus on word representation. We start with feature based approaches. We then study continuous approaches using co-occurence matrices. We end with word embedding techniques such as word2vec.

item.title: Session 3: Task-specific Modeling of Text
item.description:
Task-specific Modeling of Text

This course covers a standart task-specific NLP pipeline. We present the preprocessing steps such as encoding and tokenization. We then focus on sequence labelling illustrated by POS (Part-of-Speech) tagging and Name-Entity Recognition (NER). Finally, we present the standard evaluation metrics for classification tasks.

item.title: Session 4: Neural Natural Language Processing
item.description:
Neural Natural Language Processing

This lecture presents the most standart deep learning architectures to build Natural Language Processing models. We consider Feed-Forward Neural Networks, Recurrent Neural Network and the Long-Short-Term Memory cell, Embedding layer and Attention Mechanisms. We present these architectures in the context of Sequence Labelling tasks.

item.title: Session 6: Transfer Learning with Neural Modeling for NLP
item.description:
Transfer Learning with Neural Modeling for NLP

Transfer Learning has become ubiquitious to build state-of-the-art NLP models. This lecture presents Transfer Learning focusing on how to do Transfer Learning in NLP using word embedding techniques such as skip-gram and BERT.
